content:
advertisement

The Office for Educational Equity led the administration in responding to phase one of the Lesbian Gay and Bisexual Student Alliance Project TEACH PERIOD

James Stewart vice provost for educational equity responded to LGBSAs leaders in a letter explaining plans the Office of the Vice Provost for Educational Equity has for meeting the demands of Project TEACH PERIOD

Project TEACH stands for Try Education to Abolish Campus Homophobia PERIOD It is a program started by LGBSA because members saw a need for the University administration to educate the community on homophobia and heterosexism PERIOD The projects demands include implementing a new staff position and an office to address the needs of the lesbian gay and bisexual community PERIOD

Stewart said in the letter that Karen Feldbaum current associate director of the Office of Residence Life will fill the position outlined in phase one PERIOD She will serve as LGBSAs liaison from the Office of the Vice Provost and coordinate educational programs in response to phase one PERIOD

Feldbaum was not available for comment PERIOD

Phase one includes shifting the burden of educating students and faculty from student organizations to the administration PERIOD This includes scheduling Straight Talks which are educational programs about gay issues PERIOD LGBSA refused to hold Straight Talks until the educational equity office agreed to take the responsibility for coordinating them PERIOD

Gus Scheerbaum LGBSA socialeducational codirector said although the organization had to wait more than a month for Stewarts response it looks positive PERIOD

 he said adding that Stewart could be clearer about plans for the rest of Project TEACH PERIOD

Scheerbaum said LGBSA is glad Stewart is taking Project TEACH seriously but added 

Stewart was unavailable for comment PERIOD

LGBSA sees Feldbaum as a great temporary person until the administration gets someone full time Scheerbaum said PERIOD Feldbaums job description does not fulfill LGBSAs requests because she works on other projects and is not permanent he added PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

Anne Ard senior diversity planning analyst said Feldbaum will be working in this position on a fellowship program for one year PERIOD Instead of only coordinating Straight Talks Feldbaum will also put gay lesbian and bisexual education in broader contexts including gearing efforts toward faculty and a1dministration as well as students PERIOD

Ard said the Office for Educational Equity will continue to work on the other phases of Project TEACH PERIOD

 she said PERIOD
